Description: Very small scarab made of steatite, only small parts of base is chipped of, the drawing on the object card shows that it was complete when drawn. Few remains of a white glaze preserved at the highest part of the back as well as parts of the base, underneath the grey colour of the steatite is visible. The division between head and prothorax is shown by a single line. Elytra and prothorax are divided by a single line as well, as is the suture. The humeral callosities are indicated by carved triangles. The shape of the head is oval, the eyes are very large, the left eye is not completely preserved. The clypeus is broken off. The side shows three fully carved legs, no details shown, sitting on top of the base plate. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base, inside are two upright uraei facing to the right, in front of them an unidentified almost rectangular vertical sign, all three above a nb-basket. Above the two snakes each a small nb-basket, the left one is half broken off. The orientation of the seal is longitudinal, as is the perforation of the object.
